alert.note: Alert for Christian; Douglas; Webster (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 1:51AM CDT until July 31 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Christian County in southwestern Missouri... Western Douglas County in southwestern Missouri... Southern Webster County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 600 AM CDT. * At 151 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Seymour, Fordland, Diggins, Elkhead, Keltner, Bruner, Dogwood, Oldfield, Goodhope, Chadwick, Garrison, Rome, Christian Center and Selmore. This includes the following low water crossings... Beaver Creek at County Road 524, North Spring Creek at County Road 406, Bull Creek at Center Road, Little Beaver Creek at County Road 447, Swan Creek at Swan Cave Road, Finley River at Johns Ford Road and Cowskin Creek at Highway Y. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
